cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the design of efficient algorithms for constructing suffix arrays, which is a fundamental data structure for string searching and data compression. This topic falls under the category of data structures and algorithms, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. The most likely sub-category is cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), which is the primary category for research on data structures. The paper also involves the design of algorithms that are optimal in both time and space, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of cs.CC (Computational Complexity), which deals with the study of the resources required to solve computational problems. The paper also involves the use of integer alphabets, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), which deals with the design of algorithms for distributed and parallel computing. The paper also involves the use of information theory, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the study of information processing and communication. Finally, the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning), which deals with the design of algorithms for learning from data.
